intro: Microlicia variolosa, commonly known as the variable microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are divided into several lobes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Microlicia variolosa is often found in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soil.
